revised_title: p-Opioid Receptor-Mediated Inhibition of N-Type Calcium-Channel Current in Neurons
tldr: The authors discovered that activating p-opioid receptors in human neuroblastoma cells inhibits the N-type calcium-channel current. This inhibition is mediated by a pertussis toxin-sensitive G protein and is independent of changes in adenylate cyclase activity. The findings suggest that the p-opioid receptor belongs to the superfamily of G-protein-coupled inhibitory neurotransmitter receptors that modulate calcium and potassium channels and adenylate cyclase.
